qas.question: Who noted that Ashkenazi Jews lived in Jerusalem during the 11th century?
Another piece of evidence of German communities in the holy city in the second half of the 11th century is due to what items being sent from Germany to Jerusalem?
Mystic Rabbi Elijah of Chelm is from what century?
In the story told by mystic Rabbi Elijah of Chelm, one of the German's family members rescued Jews in Palestine and carried them back to where in order to repay a previous favor?

context: According to <a2_0>16th-century<a2_0/> mystic <a0_0>Rabbi Elijah of Chelm<a0_0/>, Ashkenazi Jews lived in Jerusalem during the 11th century. The story is told that a German-speaking Palestinian Jew saved the life of a young German man surnamed Dolberger. So when the knights of the First Crusade came to siege Jerusalem, one of Dolberger's family members who was among them rescued Jews in Palestine and carried them back to <a3_0>Worms<a3_0/> to repay the favor. Further evidence of German communities in the holy city comes in the form of <a1_0>halakhic questions<a1_0/> sent from Germany to Jerusalem during the second half of the 11th century.
